title: I am looking for buying violin in Delhi, can anyone help? I am a beginner. - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for the A2A!  Take your teacher with you, you have  no idea what you're looking for. It might be worthwhile having a quick chat about the costs first.  Remember buying a violin entails the purchase of a number of accessories, which do add to the cost. The bare minimum are:  BowRosin Violin case Shoulder rest You might also want a tuner: it will make it much easier to tune than by ear.  I will leave it to others to discuss various violin brands and places of origin. In my view they are less relevant and you need to judge on a case-by-case basis.

Assuming you already have a teacher please tame him with you. I brought a decent one about 2 years ago amd had hard luck finding good teacher. Got one a month back. There are few places in cp and few in shadipur area. Raj musicials is where i got mine.
